intro: The v-dialog component inform users about a specific task and may contain critical information, require decisions, or involve multiple tasks. Use dialogs sparingly because they are interruptive.

fullscreen.heading: Fullscreen
fullscreen.intro: Due to limited space, full-screen dialogs may be more appropriate for mobile devices than dialogs used on devices with larger screens.

transitions.heading: Transitions
transitions.intro: You can make the dialog appear from the top or the bottom.

modal.heading: Persistent
modal.intro: Similar to a Simple Dialog, except that itâ€™s not dismissed when touching outside.

scrollable.heading: Scrollable
scrollable.intro: Example of a dialog with scrollable content.

form.heading: Form
form.intro: Just a simple example of a form in a dialog.

loader.heading: Loader
loader.intro: The v-dialog component makes it easy to create a customized loading experience for your application.

nesting.heading: Nesting
nesting.intro: Dialogs can be nested: you can open one dialog from another.

overflowed.heading: Overflowed
overflowed.intro: Modals that do not fit within the available window space will scroll the container.

without.heading: Without activator
without.intro: If for some reason you are unable to use the activator slot, be sure to add the .stop modifier to the event that triggers the dialog.
